commonIssues.issue: Requirement traceability failures: criteria add unauthorized specificity or constraints not present in the system prompt or user turn
Incorrect source labeling (system vs user) leading to precedence errors and failure to account for user overrides
Use of disallowed instruction types/concepts (e.g., length_constraints:number_words/paragraph_length, detectable_content:numeric_inclusion, punctuation:question_exclaim, sentence/word-length limits)
Misuse of misalignment flag (is_misalignment_check) on system-sourced criteria or when no user override exists
Malformed turn_metadata JSON (structural/format errors causing invalid JSON)
System prompt internal contradictions in constraints (e.g., incompatible sentence/comma rules or long-form goals vs strict brevity limits)
System prompt missing required sections (e.g., precedence/conflict resolution and background/context)
Disallowed numeric inclusion checks used in instructions (instruction_id: "detectable_content:numeric_inclusion")
Disallowed word count constraints in instructions (instruction_id: "length_constraints:number_words")
Sentence-level word limits applied in instructions/llm_judge (e.g., "length_constraints:sentence_length" or sentence word-count checks) are disallowed
Paragraph length constraints used in instructions (instruction_id: "length_constraints:paragraph_length") are disallowed
Disallowed punctuation checks in instructions (instruction_id: "punctuation:question_exclaim")
Disallowed palindrome keyword checks in instructions (instruction_id: "keywords:palindrome_word")
Misalignment checks incorrectly marked with source "system" (is_misalignment_check: true with source: "system")
Missing required "source" field for llm_judge criteria
Untraceable formatting constraints (e.g., exact bullet counts, numbered list requirement, JSON detection) not supported by SI/user turn
System prompt missing required sections (Style and/or Precedence)
System prompt metadata alignment mismatch with prompt content/domain
System prompt internal inconsistency and contradictory formatting/structure requirements
Duplicate instruction entries present in the instructions array
llm_judge questions not fully answerable due to forbidden or ambiguous word/sentence/character count constraints
Use of disallowed length constraints (word/sentence/paragraph) in instructions or llm_judge
Criteria values/format do not match SI (unauthorized specificity, wrong thresholds, exact-phrase rigidity)
Use of disallowed numeric inclusion check (detectable_content:numeric_inclusion)
Use of disallowed punctuation checks (punctuation:question_exclaim)
Use of disallowed palindrome-related checks (keywords:palindrome_word or palindrome checks in llm_judge)
Source label misattribution (system vs user) or missing misalignment flags
System prompt missing required sections/content (e.g., style, background, precedence; empty prompts)
Turn metadata missing evaluation criteria arrays (no 'instructions' or 'llm_judge')
Use of disallowed keyword positioning checks (keywords:positioning)
Counter-intuitive constraint not explicit or testable in the prompt (implicit constraint)
Counter-intuitive constraint ambiguous due to conflicting or self-cancelling instructions
Prompt length exceeds specified word range (beyond tolerance)
Response reference format uses 'rule' field instead of required 'criteria' field
Imaginary constraints and golden answer imposed in response reference (requirements not in prompt)
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Ideal response references superseded instructions instead of strictly following the final request
Missing or unclear Precedence section for resolving rule/constraint conflicts
Contradictory or impossible constraints causing internal inconsistency (e.g., incompatible length limits, forced phrases/content, or numeric thresholds)
Missing or insufficient Background/context section detailing scope and limitations
Missing explicit Format section defining the required output structure
Insufficient Style guidance (overly vague tone/voice instructions)
Required sections missing from system prompt (Role, Background, Action, Constraints, Style, Format, Precedence)
Domain and Use Case metadata missing, blocking alignment checks
System prompt content missing
No testable, verifiable constraints present in the system prompt
Prohibited topics safeguards absent or cannot be verified
Internal consistency cannot be evaluated due to missing rules/content
Malformed or placeholder-only input (evaluation rubric or headers instead of prompt)
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'length_constraints:number_words' in instructions
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'detectable_content:numeric_inclusion' in instructions
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'length_constraints:sentence_length' in instructions
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'punctuation:question_exclaim' in instructions
Use of other banned instruction types (length_constraints:number_characters, length_constraints:word_length, change_case:capital_word_frequency)
Unauthorized specificity/value mismatches in detectable_format checks (e.g., table min_rows/min_cols, section/paragraph checks) causing traceability failures
Overly specific keyword checks (keywords:frequency/existence) requiring exact terms not mandated by SI/user
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'keywords:letter_frequency' in instructions
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'length_constraints:paragraph_length' in instructions
llm_judge criteria add unauthorized specificity or misapply conditional requirements (e.g., enforcing explanation-only paragraph counts, unconditional math checks)
Incorrect source labeling in llm_judge criteria (requirements tagged as 'user' instead of 'system')
Instruction criteria contradict or are not traceable to the user request (e.g., forcing safety warnings, route examples, or tailoring explicitly excluded by user)
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'length_constraints:number_words'
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'detectable_content:numeric_inclusion' (numeric digit/number counts)
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'length_constraints:sentence_length'
Use of disallowed instruction_id 'punctuation:question_exclaim' (question/exclamation mark counts)
Use of disallowed character/letter/word-level length or case constraints (e.g., number_characters, word_length, capital_word_frequency, letter_frequency)
LLM judge criteria not traceable or mis-scoped relative to SI/user (e.g., misapplied paragraph counts, penalizing absence of math, sentence-length checks, numeric digit counts)
Use of disallowed paragraph/format length constraints (e.g., detectable_format:max_paragraph_length, detectable_format:number_paragraphs, length_constraints:paragraph_length)
Untraceable keyword presence/frequency checks (requiring specific words not mandated by SI/user)
Criteria do not correctly handle system vs user instruction conflicts/overrides
Over-specific table constraints not aligned with SI (e.g., unnecessary min rows/cols)
Missing or incorrect 'source' fields on instructions causing source label accuracy failures
Untraceable or unauthorized criteria not grounded in System Instructions or user turn (invented constraints, mandatory structures, specific phrases/sections not required)
Use of disallowed evaluation criteria (e.g., word/character/sentence counts, alliteration chains, vowel ratios, punctuation counts, palindrome/ALL-CAPS counts, numeric-inclusion)
Incorrect source attribution for criteria (source set to system vs user or vice versa)
Misalignment checks incorrectly flagged or missing (is_misalignment_check misused or absent where user attempts to override SI)
Failure to respect instruction precedence (System > User), leading to criteria enforcing user overrides or contradicting SI
Value mismatches with SI specifications (e.g., wrong min rows/cols for tables, incorrect allowed punctuation set)
Duplicate testing of the same requirement across instructions and llm_judge
Hardcoded expected results in llm_judge instead of verifying formula/process compliance
Untraceable or unauthorized specificity in evaluation criteria (checks not backed by SI or user requirements, or value mismatches)
Use of disallowed evaluation concepts (e.g., word/sentence/paragraph counts, alliteration, punctuation counts, keyword positioning, vowel/letter/caps counts, numeric inclusion)
Incorrect requirement source labeling (system vs user) leading to traceability errors
Misalignment flag misuse (is_misalignment_check set true with source 'system' or used when no user override attempt exists)
Failure to reflect user overrides/precedence in criteria (checks not updated when user instructions legitimately override SI)
Evaluation questions not answerable due to disallowed metrics (e.g., explicit word/length checks)
Missing misalignment checks when user explicitly challenges SI constraints
Malformed turn_metadata JSON (syntax errors that invalidate the metadata)
Prompt lacks explicit, unambiguous, and testable counter-intuitive constraint (constraints are implicit or not quantifiable)
Invalid response_reference structure: missing criteria array or incorrect criteria field naming
Target model breaking rate below required threshold (>=75%)
Ideal response contradicts core counter-intuitive requirement (affirms incorrect claims)
Response reference includes imaginary constraints not stated in the prompt or inherent to the task
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Criteria objects use generic 'criteria' field instead of required 'criteriaN' matching their 'id' in response_reference
Missing or invalid criteria array structure in response_reference (criteria not enclosed in a proper JSON array)
Prompt lacks an explicit, testable counter-intuitive constraint required by domain
User prompt length exceeds specified 2050 word range (even with tolerance)
Evaluation criteria include golden answers or correctness requirements not provided in the prompt/task type (imaginary constraints)
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Target model breaking rate below required threshold
Criteria array objects use 'criteria'/'criterion' keys instead of required numbered 'criteriaN' matching ids (e.g., C1criteria1)
Missing criteria array structure; criteria listed as plain text or standalone objects instead of a JSON array of objects with id and criteriaN
Counter-intuitive or special constraint is implicit/ambiguous rather than explicit and testable in the prompt
User prompt exceeds specified word-count range (even with tolerance)
Rubric introduces imaginary constraints or golden answers not present in the prompt or inherent to the task type
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Target model breaking rate below required threshold (75%)
Criteria array not compliant: uses generic 'criteria' (or 'criterion') fields instead of numbered 'criteriaN' fields and/or invalid criteria object structure
User prompt below minimum required word count
No criteria array present: criteria listed as plain text or unwrapped objects rather than a JSON array
Inconsistent prompt extraction/word counting (e.g., counting non-prompt cells or recounting) leading to incorrect length evaluation
User prompt exceeds maximum allowed word count
Counter-intuitive constraint is implicit/not explicitly stated in the prompt
Imaginary constraints added in response_reference (requirements not in prompt and not inherent to task type)
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Golden answer/correctness requirements included where prohibited or over-specified for task type
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Target model breaking rate below required threshold
Missing or non-numeric prompt length requirement in metadata prevents evaluation
Response reference uses deprecated chat/message structure instead of a standalone JSON criteria array with id and criteriaX fields
Criteria objects use wrong field names ('criteria', 'criterion', or 'criteria 1') instead of required sequential 'criteriaX' names
Response reference is not a valid standalone JSON array (invalid JSON syntax, trailing commas, or embedded in text/markdown)
Ideal response fails task-type or counter-intuitive constraints (answers wrong sub-questions, adds meta-commentary/external info, or ignores the final instruction)
Ideal response misses exact quantity/word-count constraints (required counts of words, errors, answers, or distributions not met)
Prompt shorter than the minimum word-count requirement
Prompt exceeds the maximum word-count requirement
Prompt length requirement is ambiguous or missing explicit numeric range
Prompt lacks an explicit, unambiguous counter-intuitive constraint
Criteria include imaginary constraints not present in the prompt or inherent to the task type
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE

commonIssues.issue: Criteria specify golden answers/content that the prompt does not provide
commonIssues.qualityDimension: NO IMAGINARY CONSTRAINTS IN RESPONSE REFERENCE
